item.title: Report E-2024080670
item.description:
Report E-2024080670

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the tote and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to a small crack on the top corner of the tote. HEPACO personnel transferred the remaining material to a new tote, performed a slosh test, and then cleaned the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024080382
item.description:
Report E-2024080382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drums were positioned on pallets and loaded into the trailer by the generator. During the loading process, a small crack was sustained on the bottom of one drum from either the tip of a forklift, the corner of a pallet, or other drum pressing against it. The leak was not evident during the loading process or on the post-trip inspection on 7/25/24. The leak was identified while the drum was still on the trailer on 7/26/24. The spill was cleaned up by in-house staff and the original container was overpacked along with the spill clean up residual.

item.title: Report E-2024080459
item.description:
Report E-2024080459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: Avon
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30th, 2024, at 09:48, personnel at the CSXT Avon Terminal, Avon Indiana, discovered UTLX 950697, a residue tank car which last contained Butadienes, Stabilized, leaking from the vapor. The car was isolated and the shipper was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-07-30-00096). CSX Hazardous Material Team Managers found the source of cause of release was the vapor line valve not fully closed and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. It was also noted that two other secondary securement plugs were less than tool tight. CSX personnel closed the valve and properly secured all secondary closures. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Tim B. Langford, Shell Chemical, 504-208-8193)

item.title: Report E-2024080576
item.description:
Report E-2024080576

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that a strong odor was emitting from the trailer when terminal personnel attempted to open the trailer. ERTS dispatched Clean Harbors to assist. Clean harbors arrived onsite and advised that a bug cap was not secured on one of the 55-gallon drums, releasing 1-cup of product during transit. Clean Harbors placed a new bung cap on the drum and cleaned the released material.

item.title: Report E-2024080575
item.description:
Report E-2024080575

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: It was reported that one (1) teaspoon of Watcon 1492 released from one (1) 5-gallon poly pail impacting the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the release with the available PPE on-site.
